question: What are convention volunteers?
answer: They are a group of people that have agreed to help the Convention visitors find a safe, welcome and enjoyable time in Toronto. They are the face of Toronto to our visitors and those that will introduce True Canadian Hospitality to our guests.

question: Who can be a volunteer?
answer: Any Rotarian, Rotaractor, friend or family of Rotarian or Rotaractor from the host districts only and at least 17 years old can be a volunteer. For some venues you must be registered for the conference, for areas outside of the convention centre you do not.

question: What will volunteers be doing for the convention?
answer: Volunteers will be positioned at sites around the Toronto area to help our guests find their way to and from various locations in Toronto. They will be positioned at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, Union Station, all hotels, and at all major HOC events.

question: When will volunteers be needed?
answer: Volunteer assignments will be from June 22 to 27th.

question: How long will volunteers be expected to work?
answer: Typical assignments will be from 2 to 4 hours on a given day. Anyone desiring to work longer or multiple days will be happily accepted. The variation in hours is dependent on the number of volunteers we get signed up. We are looking for 1,200 volunteers for the duration of the convention.

question: Will volunteers receive training and further instruction?
answer: Orientation and training will take place for all volunteers. You will also receive a Toronto 2018 Rotary vest indicating you as a go to person when on duty at the convention.

question: Can I request a specific location or time to volunteer?
answer: All of our volunteer convention requirements are scheduled into shifts. You can select the shifts that you would like to volunteer for. This includes shift day,  shift time and even the shift location.

question: Where is the convention located?
answer: The Rotary International Convention Toronto 2018 will be held at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre and the Air Canada Centre in downtown Toronto.

question: What kind of event should we have and where?
answer: There are three types of events: 1)Personal home Hospitality, where one couple hosts 2-3 couples at their home or other location; 2) Group Host Hospitality, where more than one couple get together, usually at a home or a private club; 3) Club(s) Host Hospitality, where the entire club, or group of clubs go together to host a dinner at a location such as a restaurant, club, church, school, etc. The limitation is the distance from the downtown Toronto area, due to traffic. Venues should not be more than one hour bus ride, from the Convention Centre.

question: What else might we do?
answer: Some clubs take their guests to interesting sites in their areas or provide some interesting information on the area, history, club activities. Some provide entertainment, such as a band or a speaker, etc.

question: How do we get the guests to our venue?
answer: Buses will be provided for large groups( a bus load 40-60). If a club in an area has a number of hosts, then the bus will deliver the guests to a central location and hosts will pick up their guests individually. If you are in Toronto, it will be your responsibility to make arrangements to pick up your guests, if your group is less than 40 people.

question: What is the timing?
answer: Delegates will be expecting to leave for host hospitality at 5pm and must be returned to their hotel for 10pm.

question: Who pays for this?
answer: The hosts are responsible for the cost of this event, except for the bus transportation which will be borne by Rotary.

question: How are we to know the details of the plans?
answer: We need a contact person from your club to oversee the event. This person will be responsible for passing along information and for letting us know the number of venues and people that your club members might be able to accommodate. Sign up Sheets are required for each host and are available at each club or on line. If you have Club members who speak other languages and would like to have guests from a particular country, you need to advise us through your representative.

question: How do we contact these people?
answer: Once we have all the registrations, we will be assigning our guests to hosts. Names, hotel information, emails and phone numbers will be provided when possible.

question: If we have friends in Rotary can they be added to our group?
answer: Yes, you may add them to your guest list but they will not be part of our Host Hospitality list of people , who we identify as being your guests.

question: How can I sign up as a guest?
answer: Just click on Events in the main menu above, then click on Host Hospitality and then click on Buy Now.

question: Can I register with my friends so we can attend the same event?
answer: YES, We will do our best to keep you and your friends together as long as you all register at the same time.

question: Is transportation to and from the Host Hospitality event included?
answer: Yes unless the venue is within easy walking distance.

question: I have some mobility issues. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes, just let us know what they are when you register.

question: I have specific food requests. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes, simply let us know about your dietary restrictions when you register.

question: Is there a limit on the number of Host Hospitality tickets available?
answer: YES, SO PLEASE REGISTER AS SOON AS POSSIBLE, AS THIS EVENT SELLS OUT QUICKLY.

question: What events are taking place on Saturday Night?
answer: There are two events taking place Jazz at the Aquarium and Rock at the Distillery DIstrict. This FAQ is about Jazz at the Aquarium.

question: What is Aquarium?
answer: Ripley’s Aquarium of Canada is the home of 16,000 aquatic animals and features North America’s longest underwater viewing tunnel with more than 5.7 million liters of water and over 100 interactive opportunities. It consists of nine curated galleries with saltwater and freshwater environments from around the world, including an exhibit of the Great Lakes basin.

question: Is admission to the full Aquarium included as part of the event?
answer: Yes.

question: Is there a marine life show included as part of the event?
answer: Yes, the divers go inside the tank to feed the animals and perform.

question: How do I buy tickets for Jazz at the Aquarium?
answer: Just click on Events in the main menu above, then click on Jazz at the Aquarium and then click on Buy Now.

question: Can I register with my friends so we can attend the same event?
answer: Yes, absolutely!

question: Is transportation to and from Jazz at the Aquarium included?
answer: It is a 2 minute walk (just next door) from the Metro Convention Center which is where the Convention is being hosted.

question: I have some mobility issues. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes, absolutely!

question: I have specific food requests. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes, a variety of food will be served.

question: Is there a limit on the number of Jazz at the Aquarium tickets available?
answer: Yes, only 1200 tickets available.

question: What events are taking place on Saturday Night?
answer: There are two events taking place Rock at the Distillery District and Jazz at the Aquarium. This FAQ is about the Rock at the Distillery District.

question: What is the Distillery District?
answer: It is an Architectural Wonder, the previous home of Gooderham and Wort’s Distillery, one of Canada’s first distilleries. Nearly 20 years ago a small group of visionary developers looked at a collection of Victorian industrial buildings that had been pronounced a historic site and imagined transforming it into something unique and exciting. What you will see is a fusion of old and new, an inspired blend of Victorian Industrial architecture and stunning 21st century designs and creativity. The result is an internationally acclaimed village of stores, shops, galleries, studios, restaurants, cafes, theaters and more.

question: How do I buy tickets for Rock at the Distillery District?
answer: Just click on Events in the main menu above, then click on Rock at the Historic Distillery District and then click on Buy Now.

question: Can I register with my friends so we can attend the same event?
answer: Yes, absolutely!

question: Is transportation to and from Rock at the Distillery District included?
answer: No, however it is a short stroll from the Convention Centre or a 10 minute ride on a TTC bus which will drop you off right at the entrance gate.

question: I have some mobility issues. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes absolutely!

question: I have specific food requests. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes, there will be a variety of food available.

question: Is there a limit on the number of Rock at the Distillery District tickets available?
answer: Yes, we are only selling 3000 tickets.

question: What is ROTARYFEST?
answer: ROTARYFEST is modeled on Rotary community celebrations held across Canada which feature BBQ foods and great entertainment. These celebrations make our local neighbourhoods better places in which to live, they unite us in celebration of family, shared values and community.

question: How do I buy tickets for ROTARYFEST?
answer: Just click on Events in the main menu above, then click on ROTARYFEST and then click on Buy Now.

question: Can I register with my friends so we can attend the same event?
answer: Yes absolutely!!

question: Is transportation to and from ROTARYFEST included?
answer: Yes, buses will depart from the Metro Convention center. Headquarters for Rotary Toronto 2018.

question: I have some mobility issues. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes!

question: I have specific food requests. Is there accommodation for people like me?
answer: Yes, there will be a variety of food available, vegetarian and halal.

question: Is there a limit on the number of ROTARYFEST tickets available?
answer: Yes. We plan to welcome 5000 guests at ROTARYFEST.

question: Can anyone attend this event?
answer: This event is only open to Medical Professionals.

question: Are there any accreditation hours available?
answer: Application has been made for CME accreditation hours.

question: Is there a rendezvous point to meet at to go to this event.
answer: Registrants are expected to make their own way to the Women’s College Hospital 76 Grenville St, Toronto, ON M5S 1B2
